results.title: Who's that girl?
results.creator_credit: Sarah Sneddon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sarah Sneddon delves back into the wonderfully bizarre world of her childhood, with its tutus, false eyelashes, hair nets, exams, glitz and glamour.

results.title: Who's running this school?
results.creator_credit: Jack Zalkalns, John Honey, Tasmania. Education Dept. and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Investigates some of the problems of school administration and management by focusing upon a dramatized presentation of one of the first days in the job of Annie Probert, a newly appointed school principal. Although she is not feeling well, her day looks fairly simple. However, as the days develops, unexpected problems intervene and Annie becomes a victim of the multiple expectations that are a universal hazard of the job. Useful in the areas of decision making, conflict resolution, time management and leadership.

results.title: Who's running things?
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “What Do You Think”.
The boys in a high-school gym class are penalized by their leader for breaking the rules. The film asks if, after a leader is elected, those who chose him can justifiably override his authority.

results.title: Who's responsible?
results.creator_credit: Robert Sande and JW Newman Corp
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Guidance for the 70’s”.
I am the cause of my own effects. This is a difficult concept for many to accept; most people prefer to “blame” others or environment for what happens to them. Teenagers attending a PACE conference deal with the concept of responsibility. Their discussions highlight how ‘what happens to you is under your own control to a very great extent’ and that, by exercising your choice, you can ‘create the effect your want to have in your life’.

results.title: Who's in control (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
To carry out a plan or implement a decision a degree of organisation needs to occur. What individuals do (job design), how people relate formally to one another (organisational structure) and how this gets co-ordinated are the essential organising activities. At the same time, mechanisms to establish if the planning, organising, motivating, etc. is achieving what intended to occur. Self correcting control or control followed by corrective action needs to be built into all management processes.

results.title: Who's in charge? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Michael Darlow, Robert Reid and Video Arts
results.brief_description: Demonstrates some of the challenges and problems that Mike Hammett, the new despatch supervisor encounters in his first days on the job. At first Mike receives no help from his immediate boss who should help and support him.

results.title: Who's handicapped?
results.creator_credit: Dept of Employment and Industrial Relations and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The problems facing the mentally and physically handicapped to find employment and make a new life are studied in this film. The film is aimed at potential employers and shows a series of case histories of people who are socially deprived, emotionally unstable, the physically handicapped and mentally retarded.

results.title: Who's handicapped
results.creator_credit: Nigel Evans, Harry Bromley Davenport and Sideline Productions
results.brief_description: Although Britain sets up special schools to develop the intellectually handicapped to their potential, this film shows that both handicapped and non-handicapped children are limited by the social barriers that prevent them interacting. Includes a drama session which Dorothy Heathcote takes with some disabled children.

results.title: Who's boss
results.creator_credit: Alexander Hammid, Irving Jacoby and Affiliated Film Producers
results.brief_description: Deals with the struggle between a young married couple to attain a balance of power in their relationship. Both are successful in their repsective careers, yet unable to make a success of their marriage. After two years of conflict and a serious quarrel, they decide to make a determined cooperative effort to salvage their marriage. Although adjustment is slow and difficult, they ultimately acheive a balance that enables both of them to contribute equally to ‘breadwinning’ and ‘homemaking’. Neither is boss both both partners share the reponsibilities of the home.
